item.title: Bitmine: Increased its ETH holdings by approximately 190,000 coins last week, bringing the total ETH holdings to 1.713 million coins
item.description: On August 25th, as per prnewswire, the US-listed company Bitmine (BMNR) announced today that the total value of its cryptocurrency holdings and cash has exceeded 8.82 billion US dollars. As of 5:30 pm Eastern Time on August 24th, the company's cryptocurrency holdings consist of 1,713,899 ETH (priced at $4,808 per ETH, sourced from Bloomberg), 192 Bitcoins (BTC), and $562 million in unrestricted cash.BitMine's Chairman, Tom Lee, said: "In the past week, BitMine has added 190,500 ETH to its cryptocurrency and cash holdings, increasing the total from 1.52 million ETH to 1.71 million ETH, and the holdings have grown by $2.2 billion to reach 8.8 billion. This is our second week of raising funds from institutional investors at such a pace in pursuit of the goal of reaching 5% of the total ETH supply."

item.title: Market News: Bitmine Increases ETH Holdings by $2.2 Billion in the Past Week
item.description: August 25th. As per market information, Bitmine has augmented its ETH holdings by $2.2 billion during the past week.

item.title: BiyaPay Analyst: News-Driven Rally Fading, BTC to Resume Downtrend
item.description: On August 25th, according to BiyaPay analysts, following a period of high-level oscillations, Bitcoin experienced a pullback. The news-driven rally was not sustainable, and the market reverted to being technically driven. Both the weekly and daily charts showed continuous declines, with the price remaining under pressure below the moving averages. The indicators signaled a death cross, indicating a bearish bias in the overall trend. Analysts cautioned against falling into bull traps, as any rebound was merely a technical correction within the downtrend.Yesterday, the daily chart formed a small bearish candlestick, continuing the downward trend. The price remained under pressure below the moving averages, and the indicators continued to show a death cross, maintaining a bearish outlook. The hourly chart shows a slight morning bounce to around 113700 after a dip in the early morning but then weakened again. Currently, there is a continued bearish trend with the indicators forming anoth

item.title: Cryptocurrency Market Cap Dips Below $4 Trillion as Altcoin Market Cap Sees a 3.58% Intraday Drop
item.description: On August 25th, based on Coingecko data, with the overall cryptocurrency market experiencing a downturn today, the total crypto market capitalization has fallen below $4 trillion and currently stands at $3.923 trillion, with a 24-hour decrease of 3.1%.The altcoin (excluding BTC) market capitalization has dropped 4.4% from the intraday high and 3.58% since 8:00 today, and now it is at $1.58 trillion.

item.title: The current mainstream CEX and DEX funding rate indicates a slightly bearish market sentiment.
item.description: On August 25th, based on Coinglass data, the current funding rates of mainstream CEX and DEX suggest a slightly bearish sentiment in the market. The specific funding rates are presented in the following chart.BlockBeats Note: The funding rate is a rate determined by cryptocurrency exchanges to maintain the balance between the contract price and the underlying asset price. It is usually applicable to perpetual contracts and serves as a funding exchange mechanism between long and short traders. The trading platform does not charge this fee. Its purpose is to adjust the cost or profit of traders holding contracts to keep the contract price close to the underlying asset price.When the funding rate is 0.01%, it represents the baseline rate. When the funding rate is higher than 0.01%, it indicates a generally bullish market. When the funding rate is lower than 0.005%, it suggests a generally bearish market.

item.title: YGG Completes $1 Million Token Buyback, with an average buy price of around $0.17
item.description: On August 25th, according to the monitoring of on-chain data analyst Yu Jin, YGG carried out a $1 million buyback of YGG tokens. They deposited 1 million USDT into Binance in the early hours of the day before yesterday. Then, last night, they withdrew 5.873 million YGG from Binance at an average purchase price of $0.17 per token.

item.title: A whale spent $4.26 million to accumulate 96,976 HYPE tokens.
item.description: On August 25th, as per the monitoring of Onchain Lens, during the past five days, a whale transferred $4.26 million into Hyperliquid and used it to purchase 96,976 HYPE at a price of $43.84 per HYPE.

item.title: BlackRock Deposits 1,703 BTC to Coinbase Prime, Worth Approximately $190 Million
item.description: On August 25th, as per the monitoring of LookOnChain, BlackRock has just transferred 1703 bitcoins (approximately $190 million) into Coinbase Prime.

item.title: Point of View: All Bitcoin Holding Groups of a Certain Scale Now Clearly in Distribution Phase
item.description: On August 25th, Glassnode made a statement suggesting that all scaled Bitcoin holder groups have clearly entered the distribution stage, with the group holding 10–100 bitcoins being in a dominant position. The trends of various holder groups are in line with each other, highlighting the emergence of widespread selling pressure in the market.

item.title: Reuters: U.S. Bank Lobbies to Block Payment of Interest with Stablecoin Due to Concerns About Deposit Outflows
item.description: On August 25th, as per Reuters, Bank of America is advocating for amendments to the new stablecoin regulatory rules. It is concerned that these rules might lead to a multi-trillion-dollar capital outpour. This also underscores the escalating competition between Wall Street and the cryptocurrency industry.Last week, bank lobbying groups such as the American Bankers Association (ABA), the Bank Policy Institute (BPI), and the Consumer Bankers Association (CBA) alerted lawmakers to the "loopholes" in the regulations that could enable some cryptocurrency exchanges to indirectly offer interest to stablecoin holders.The Genius Act, which was passed by the U.S. Congress in July, is intended to regulate the $2.88 trillion global stablecoin market. The law prohibits issuers from providing "yield" or interest to customers. Under the new regulations, banks are permitted to issue their own stablecoins but are not allowed to pay any interest.
